listing.title: Important Information Regarding to Former Developer
content: To those who may be concerned, we had temporarily shut down 2D Image Roleplay regarding a recent unexpected scenario that occurred during this time.

As it turns out, a now-former Developer of WonderStars, @mintyconfetticake, has been suspected of manipulating the owner to gather intelligence, as well as downloading a copy of 2D Image Roleplay (version 3.11.1) without proper authorisation.
A document about this incident has been made and posted on the WonderStars Discord server with all the submitted evidence. If you want to learn more about this, you can read it yourself.
This experience has now been reinstated after certain security patches have been made to ensure the safety of our users.
Notice: You must be at least 13 years old to use Discord.

listing.title: V3.13: New Settings and World People Counts (3 Mar 2024)
content: Updated thumbnail for the Lobby map in Map Selector.
Made changes to the credits in Settings.
We have changed the size of the Report prompt, and this also fixes the issue where sometimes the contents of the window don't appear as it opens.
Added info text showing location information.
This shows your current location on the map, based on the zone you last visited. You can turn this off in the Settings.
Improved the Roleplay Name filter whitelist.
This list will now get frequent updates without updating the entire experience.
Added settings to hide or change the behaviour of the Minimap.
For new users, the minimap rotation behaviour will be set to 'Fixed' by default but can be changed to rotate automatically with the camera in Settings.
Added options to toggle the visibility of specific information in the status bar.
These settings can be found in the Miscellaneous category.
Fixed issue where some keywords return no results.
Added a player count to the Worlds list.

listing.title: V3.12: AFK Tag, Improved Icons, etc. (25 Feb 2024)
content: Fixed an issue where in other maps, the text for the Map Select button shows as 'Lobby' by default.
Made sure that the icon for the Map Select button uses the thumbnail for the maps.
Ensured that characters won't be colliding each other again.
This caused numerous exploit attempts such as flinging people. This also affects other features and easter eggs, such as claiming the 'Shout of Wonder' and the 'Pro Gamer' badge.
Fixed an issue where users cannot submit a report relating to sending messages in chat.
Changed capitalisation for 'Crop position' and 'Crop size'.
Made additional fixes user interface issues.
Made the Menu not drag-scrollable while the Rules window is open.
Added the names of TADC characters to the filter whitelist.
Setting your RP Name to one of the mentioned characters is guaranteed to not be filtered anymore as long as it's in a proper format.
Changed colour for the notification dot to make it more noticeable.
Fixed Nametag blocking part of the chat bubble.
Made some improvements to the chat filter.
This makes servers run a little bit faster now, especially with multiple messages being sent at a time thanks to caching.
Improved icons for the Menu, Inventory and Rules.
Added an 'Idle/AFK' tag that appears if no input has been detected from the user for at least 1 minute.
Fixed an issue where dropped Dice sometimes remains if its owner has left the server.
Made sure that the sides of the D20 Dice when equipped does not clip through images.
For technical reasons, The dice now appear as a black colour when equipped, but it'll appear as pink when dropped.
Made some changes to the Laptop prop.
Moved the Menu button to the side of the minimap.
This was done due to a Roblox UI update that causes its buttons on the left side to block the Menu button.
Fixed an issue with the structure in V2 Lobby.
This shows that if a character spawns in the middle of the Lobby Park, they teleport to the top of the structure.
Made some fixes to the Friday Night Maps world.
Fixed an issue with the thumbnail for the 'Friday Night Maps' World as being low-quality.
Renamed the map from 'Sonic EXE' to 'Sonic.EXE'.

listing.title: V3.11: New props, new maps! (18 Feb 2024)
content: Fixed an issue where an error mostly occurs when selecting a saved item from the Morph library.
This happens to both the Favourites and the Recents. This issue has been fixed and most images can be used now.
Added a new system where people can now be banned for 3 days after sending too many filtered messages.
Fixed an issue where people get banned by the anti-cheat unexpectedly due to localisation problems.
Added 2 new props to the experience.
Improved the thumbnail for some maps in the Map selector.
The thumbnail for some maps now shows an image of one specific place instead of showing the entire map, making it clear what is actually inside.
Added new maps to the experience!

We have added new maps based on the popular action rhythm game, "Friday Night Funkin'". These maps are based on the top 3 popular mods: Vs. Kapi, Mid-fight masses, and Sonic.EXE. To access the World containing these maps, go to Menu > Worlds, and select 'Friday Night Maps'.

listing.title: Information regarding to February shutdown
content: It's been a while since the last shutdown of 2D Image Roleplay, but we did it again for the first time ever this year. Here is a story as to what happened and why the experience has shut down in the first place.

There has been a recent admin abuse that happened a few days ago in which a now-blacklisted former staff member gave almost every person flying, causing the anti-cheat to ban them in an instant. Because of this tragic scenario, we have no choice but to unrank the person who is potentially responsible and shut down the experience to prevent further damage.

If you have seen another (probably undercover) staff member who does this kind of behaviour, don't hesitate to report to us immediately by sending a message to @namireen via Roblox's Message feature, or on our official Discord server.

listing.title: V3.10 Release Notes (2 Feb 2024)
content: Fixed an issue where people can't send messages when the chat fonts are set to italic ones (e.g. Source Sans Italic).
Fixed the issue where Graphics settings for Computer has most lighting settings turned off by default.
Fixed the intensity of sun rays as it was too bright when looked directly at the sun.
Fixed an issue where certain props outside the Market falsely triggers the anti-cheat.

listing.title: V3.9 Release Notes (21 Jan 2024)
content: Fixed a problem where people get banned by the anti-cheat for having certain props that are outside the Market.
Fixed an issue where two of the same character sounds were playing simultaneously.
[Market] Made the Props items section not scrollable while the 'Confirm purchase' dialogue is open.
Fixed an issue where people did not claim the 'Met the Creator' badge immediately when joining a server with the creator already in it.
Added a badge for playing the game for 30 minutes straight.
Fixed Bottle prop clipping through images.
[Morph] Added size and position fields for the Image Crop screen.
These new settings allow you to enable or disable textures or meshes, as well as lighting such as atmosphere, bloom, and shadows.
Made most props affect loudness when changing the Props Volume.

listing.title: V3.8 Release Notes (14 Jan 2024)
content: Fixed an issue where the anti-cheat sometimes kicks players when jumping off of a seat.
Added some improvements to the anti-cheat.
Fixed an issue where tapping and holding certain elements (like a prop item) doesn't work properly on mobile.
We have this issue since the release of V3. We tried fixing this issue once, but failed.
Made improvements for the Report feature.
Made sure that the loading screen is skipped immediately when clicking on 'Skip loading'.
Added more teleport points in V2 Lobby.
Added a minimap for the Beach.

listing.title: Introducing 2D Image Roleplay V3
content: We have finally released the new major update of 2D Image Roleplay: Version 3. Now with a new look, new features, and a lot yet to come!
Here are some things that we've done in this major release:

This feature allows you to set an image on the back side of your morph. Simply go to the Morph screen, click the arrow beside the 'Back' field, and select an image from the Library. You can also type it in manually if you want.
Added Mori and an EXP system

We have added a feature that lets you earn Mori (a virtual currency) and EXP by visiting this experience. This will also help combat against abuse which means if people use an alt, they won't use intrusive props such as Boomboxes and Signs once they newly join.

It allows you to show or hide the hotbar, move props by holding down their respective button and clicking to somewhere in the hotbar or hide it in the Inventory window, and search for props using the search bar at the top right corner.

To improve performance, we have split certain maps into 'Worlds'. This feature allows you to go to certain Worlds by entering one of the portals (in the Lobby), or by clicking on the 'Worlds' button on the menu.

This includes custom chat filtering, which blocks certain words that some people might find offensive, and improvements with Amburn, our proprietary anti-cheat engine built specifically for 2D Image Roleplay.
We improved how everything in the interface behaves when being interacted. This includes collapsible panels in the Morph screen on mobile to fit more items more easily.
We have managed to optimise this experience to make it more accessible on lower-end devices, including devices before 2018.
Added Emu Otori to the Lobby
More features are yet to come in the near future!

listing.title: Information regarding to V2 shutdown
content: People are waiting to get 2D Image Roleplay to be publicly available again, and some are catching up on the progress of V3. It's been a while since the experience has been closed, so here are the reasons why we have to shut down the old 2D Image Roleplay V2.

The first is to maintain the safety of other people as this major update includes a new safety system and a couple of security updates. Second, we will use the public release to assess certain features such as teleporting to other Worlds. And third, we had to shut it down because of an issue with the anti-cheat.

Do not worry, as all your data from V2 which includes your Favourites, Recent Morphs, etc. are moved over to the new V3, and people who were banned by the anti-cheat due to an issue have now been unbanned.

listing.title: Beware of Imitators
content: Experiences can be copied, decompiled, and saved entirely by bad actors using exploits, and a developer with malicious intent will also re-publish it and claim it as theirs.
If you ever see an exact or slightly modified replica of 2D Image Roleplay, we recommend that you immediately report it to us on our community server.
Imitations of this experience shall be removed under copyright law, so if we ever see one, we may file a DMCA takedown request against it.

A person (which we will not disclose the name for safety reasons) had attempted to copy the entire 2D Image Roleplay V2 and its assets, but that isn't much of a big deal anymore because it's the previous version of this experience. You can learn more about this situation in the document posted on our community server (13+ only).

archive.title: V3.7 Release Notes (6 Jan 2024)
content: Fixed an issue regarding the sound for the Airhorn prop.
Sounds coming from the Airhorn prop cannot be heard from farther away anymore.
Fixed sound distance for the Drums prop.
Made sure that cropping resets when restoring defaults for the scaling in the Morph screen.
Removed 'amongusred3223' from the Special Thanks section in the Settings.
This is due to a breach of contract with the mentioned user, and other reasons that we should rather not disclose.
Added an option to use the system time as the time of day in the Settings.
Fixed issues with the chat filter.
Updated role icon for people whose chatting features are disabled.

archive.title: V3.6 Release Notes (30 Dec 2023)
content: Fixed the sound distance for the Piano in the Lobby.
Fixed writing issue in the About section of the Settings.
Added buttons that allows you to restore certain properties to their defaults on the Morph customisation.

archive.title: V3.5 Release Notes (23 Dec 2023)
content: Fixed an issue where Special group members don't have Gold Membership automatically.
Done some rewording on the Selfie screen and Favourites removal messages.
Updated search keyword blacklist for the Audio Library.
Fixed an issue where characters start colliding with each other.
Added a sign beside the Portal Ad in the Lobby.
Prevent new items from getting added to the people list when searching for a person.
Fixed an issue with the in-experience chat system.
Fixed an issue with saving purchased props.
Fixed issues with the custom chat filter.
Updated the icon for Owner and Co-owner.
Some people think that the cloud icon (which refers to the Team Teriffic logo back then), does not mean anything to them, so we have changed it.
Made some improvements to the chat filter.
Added Christmas decorations to the Lobby.

archive.title: V3.4 Release Notes (17 Dec 2023)
content: Fixed an issue where the Market sometimes doesn't load indefinitely.
Added text labels to the expand/collapse buttons of the Morph panels for easy access.
Fixed scaling issues with the Updates dialogue.
Fixed an issue where the screenshot sound effect does not play.
Pressing the 'Print Screen' key on your keyboard when inside certain screens does not play a sound. This issue has now been resolved.
Added a Portal Advertisement to the lobby.
Added system message for when a person has been banned by Amburn.
Fixed an issue where when a character dies, the corresponding people list item doesn't reset.
Removed the automatic removal of Layered Clothing.

Since exploits regarding Layered Clothing are infrequent nowadays, we have decided that we now removed a safety feature that has been added since V2 as we found that some people are complaining and showing their frustrations about the mentioned safety feature.
Fixed an issue where consumable props could be duped by resetting the character before they are loaded into the backpack.
Added a piano to the Lobby.
To avoid the possibility of being banned, ensure that you either create an original piece or possess the appropriate rights to use the soundtrack you intend to play on the Harp.

archive.title: V3.3 Release Notes (13 Dec 2023)
content: Updated the Audio Search keyword blacklist.
Added 'TADC' to the Featured Searches in the Image Library.
Made the 'Development Build' text not visible on release builds.
Added custom text filtering to roleplay names, bios, and Text Signs.
Fixed some formatting issues with the people list.
Fixed an issue where the Menu can still be drag-scrolled with a mouse while the Updates dialogue is open.
Fixed a serious issue where Amburn refuses to work.
We didn't see this issue happening until we realised that a person who's not a staff member can fly without triggering the anti-cheat.
Made use of the keyword blacklist when selecting an image that's not from the Marketplace.
Fixed some issues about searching for people whose roleplay name is changed after joining.
It may not block words that the chat filter thinks it's offensive anymore, but that doesn't guarantee that it'll not block certain non-blacklisted words.
Added the V2 Lobby map as a World.
You can now visit the lobby from the previous major release of 2D Image Roleplay. To visit it, go to Menu > Worlds > V2 Lobby and click 'Teleport'.

archive.title: V3.2 Release Notes (6 Dec 2023)
content: Done some changes to group blacklist.
Fixed an issue where some words were unintentionally blocked in the chat by the filter.
Fixed some issues with validating images.
There was an issue where some images in the Image Library failed to validate, especially ones made by Roblox groups.
Fixed an issue where staff members and Special people can be reported.
We saw that staff members and Special people were shown in the dropdown when opening the Report prompt. That issue has now been resolved.
Fixed issues with the banning system.
Fixed an issue where the World Teleport prompt and the Worlds selection screen can be scrolled simultaneously by dragging with a mouse.
Added a safety component to The Beach.
